description: Erection of a single storey outbuilding to provide granny annexe for ancillary use to the main dwelling.
decision_conditions: The development must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date hereof.Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended.

The outbuilding hereby permitted shall be only used for purposes ancillary and incidental to the main dwelling and for no other purposes. It shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling known as 3 St Thomas Row, Calthorpe Gardens, Sutton, SM1 3DU. It shall at no time be used as a separate residential unit. To ensure the ancillary nature of the outbuilding it shall at no time have;i) a separate postal address, ii) separate metres for the provision of services,iii) a separate and registered Land Registry title,iv) a separate Council tax account,v) a separate access independent of the main dwelling house.Reason:  To ensure the ancillary nature of the outbuilding hereby permitted is not used as a separate unit of residential accommodation or for purposes other than that incidental to the enjoyment of the main dwellinghouse in accordance with policies 9 and 29 of the Sutton Local Plan.

The development must be carried out in accordance with the provisions of the Fire Safety Statement - 3 St. Thomas Row, Calthorpe Gardens, Sutton SM1 3DU by ALOZIE ARCHITECTS.Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates the necessary fire safety measures in accordance with the Mayor's London Plan Policy D12.

The outbuilding hereby approved shall be clad in timber.Reason: To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to preserve the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Policy of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.

The flat roof of the single storey outbuilding in the rear garden hereby approved shall not be used, all or in part, as a terrace or other amenity space. No railings, fences, walls or other means of enclosure shall be erected on this flat roof. Reason: Such a use could be harmful to the existing amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring residential properties as a result of overlooking and loss of privacy and the generation of noise and disturbance contrary to Policy 29 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.
